entry.title: Smoke Outlook for September 1 2017 (Sunrise Fire Wildfire)
entry.summary: Smoke: Overall Friday is best represented by “Good” to “Moderate” for air quality. Smoke is expected to filter back into valley locations overnight. Air quality for the weekend is expected to degrade. Fire: The Sunrise fire is located 11 miles SE of Superior, MT adjacent to I-90. Southwest portion of the fire continues to back and flank. Minimal fire growth has been observed and an increase in acreage is not expected on the Sunrise fire. Other: Slightly cooler temperatures Friday accompanied by breezy west winds on the ridgetops. A strong ridge of high pressure will re-establish itself across the Western United States through the upcoming weekend brining record high temperatures and continued dry conditions. Fires with active perimeters should expect an increase in fire behavior. Air quality has improved across the forecast area and is expected to remain in the “Good” range for Superior and Alberton. entry.title: Stage III evacuations expected to be lifted Friday, September 1st. (Sunrise Fire Wildfire)
entry.summary: Closures & Evacuations: Stage III evacuations remain in effect for Quartz Creek and Cougar Gulch. Evacuation orders in the Cougar Gulch are expected to be lifted at 8:00 am Friday September
